intro: Elissarrhena, commonly known as the red mangrove, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rhizophoraceae. It is characterized by its distinctive red, knobby roots that help stabilize coastal soils and prevent erosion. The plant thrives in brackish water environments, often found in mangrove forests along tropical coastlines. Its leaves are typically oval-shaped and have a waxy surface to reduce water loss. Elissarrhena plays a vital role in marine ecosystems by providing habitat for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
